My general feeling is that pull request abandonment is more a result of development friction with complex processes of the project than it is about the individual contributors themselves. Often times people just don't have the time to invest very heavily in working on something so processes need to be designed in a way to encourage landing quickly and smoothly and not having single-ownership responsibility that can result in features stagnating if the owner has to leave the project in the future. People change their career trajectory all the time so expecting individuals to own a bit of code forever is unrealistic.
